title: How to Make Grilled Squid

steps.headline: Clean the squid.
steps.description: Remove the head of the squid, discard the innards and pull out the "spine". The "spine" in a squid is a translucent stick-like structure. Peel off the purple skin, leaving a clean white body. Remove the tentacles, but don't discard them. Wash each squid thoroughly and pat them dry with paper towels.

steps.headline: Make the marinade.
steps.description: In a deep-sided dish, combine the lemon zest, cumin, salt and pepper, garlic and olive oil. Mix well.

steps.headline: Marinate the squid.
steps.description: Put the squid into the marinade and stir well. Cover tightly with cling film and place in the fridge to marinate for a minimum of 30 minutes.

steps.headline: Heat the grill pan over a high temperature until very hot.
Grill the squid.
steps.description: Remove the squid from the marinade and grill both sides for a maximum of 2 minutes.

steps.headline: Garnish and serve.
steps.description: Place the squid on a serving dish, sprinkle over the fresh herbs, add the slices of lime and serve.

text: Clean the squid. Remove the head of the squid, discard the innards and pull out the "spine". The "spine" in a squid is a translucent stick-like structure. Peel off the purple skin, leaving a clean white body. Remove the tentacles, but don't discard them. Wash each squid thoroughly and pat them dry with paper towels. Make the marinade. In a deep-sided dish, combine the lemon zest, cumin, salt and pepper, garlic and olive oil. Mix well. Marinate the squid. Put the squid into the marinade and stir well. Cover tightly with cling film and place in the fridge to marinate for a minimum of 30 minutes. Heat the grill pan over a high temperature until very hot.  Grill the squid. Remove the squid from the marinade and grill both sides for a maximum of 2 minutes. Garnish and serve. Place the squid on a serving dish, sprinkle over the fresh herbs, add the slices of lime and serve.
